meanings.definition: Well-known for a bad quality or deed.
meanings.sent1: The infamous criminal was known by everyone in town.
meanings.sent2: The bank robber became infamous for his daring heists.
meanings.sent3: The infamous prankster left a trail of chaos wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: Her infamous temper was like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The infamous bully's name struck fear into the hearts of the students.

meanings.definition: Having a reputation of the worst kind.
meanings.sent1: The infamous dictator ruled with an iron fist.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was infamous for its ghostly sightings.
meanings.sent3: The infamous haunted hayride was more funny than scary.
meanings.sent4: The storm left an infamous trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The infamous gossip spread like wildfire through the small town.
